result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey L Pruess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both counts are concurrent with each other, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is to maintain sobriety - do not consume or possess any alcohol, with random testing
.

Comply with Behavior counseling

Complete any other evaluations or conditions PO deems necessary

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

The Court may grant an early dishcarge after one year following the successful completion of the conditions of this Court Order to include payment of financial obligation in full, adherence to the rules of supervision and upon the recommendation of the PO

Credit for 3 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION REJECTION

Start of jail sentence is delayed for 30 days.  The Court needs proof that the defendant is in a program and then will Vacate the remainder of the jail time

Court costs/fees are Waived on both counts
.

.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Ct 1 of this case
.

from PO Mark Fries    re: Rejection of Probation - sentencing recommendations
Def's Motion to Refuse Balance of Probation & to be Sentenced
Probation Rejection

State by Donskey /  Def in custody w/ Atty Joseph Randtke
DEF'S MOTION TO REJECT PROBATION
CRT accepts rejection of probation
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Ct 1 - 100 days CJ  /  Ct 2 - 90 days CJ Consecutive to Ct 1
Credit is 101 days
CRT costs are Waived on this case
Jail sentence is delayed for 30 days - CRT needs proof that def is in the Program, then will vacate the remainder of the jail time
Notice not mailed - no current address
Order for Attorney Fees. No forwarding address.

for Sentence Modification  for early release to be able to keep apartment
PER TWB:  DENIED - If a furlough would salvage his apartment, CRT may grant a day next week

for Sentence Modification - release for treatment - Per TWB - DOC needs to get Def into treatment,
I will grant furlough when that happens per JOC.
from PO Mark Fries    re: Judicial Review

10:43 am Def in court, in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PO agent Frise
No counsel here for Mr. Pruess.  Mr. Pruess would like an atty.   Court will continue this until tomorrow.  Pruess says he can't wait another day.  Court:  You're looking at 90 days.  One more day won't matter.  Pruess then states he wants to talk about it today.  Skemp comments.  He's threatened his agent.  He drinks and become violent.  I do think that 90 days w/o release is appropriate.  He needs to establish a drug an alcohol treatment placement so his jail time may need to be adjusted.  Frise comments about Pruess' threats and volitility.  In reality, we should probably revoke this case because he won't listen.  We'll give him this one chance to get him into treatment.  But he'll probably go back out and drink.  Court addresses Mr. Pruess.  Mr. Frise, are there any mental issues we need to deal with?  Frise doesn't know because he won't work with us.
AS AN ADD'L CONDITION OF PROBATION:  Orders 90 days CJ w/ credit back to May 22, 2015. If Mr. Frise can get you into appropriate treatment, the balance of the jail can be stayed.  If you complete the treatment successfully, I'll vacate the balance.
for Attorney Fees signed by Judge - to repay Clerk of Courts $1440.75 at a rate of $10 a mo
for atty fees for Atty Daniel Ryan for $1,440.75 - sent to Finance 5/6/15.
assigned PO Dayna Albitz

State by Jessica Skem;  Def. in person with Dan Ryan;
3:36 Dan Ryan it is a plea - you did find him guilty at last hrg. 
Def, I did grab her wrist but I had pain also when needle when in flesh
COURT:  EITHER YOU ARE GUILTY OR YOU ARE NOT AND WHAT DID YOU DO FOR IT TO BE A BATTERY
He admits and he remembers the resiting when getting in chair 
Ct. 1 Battery as a repeater- plea of guilty, Ct. 2 Resisting an officer as a repeater - plea of guilty, guilty plea quest. on file, no promises, no threats, plea FVI made, suff. factual basis, found guilty
SENT:  w/h prob. 18 months and if you can do it within a year the court may cut you early, 3 days credit, AODA assm., comply with behavior counseling, maintain sob., no alc., random testing, any other evals up to your agent, 267.00 court cts., and get that paid off before being released from probation
